PAN AMERICAN AIRWAYS, INC.
135 EAST 42nd STREET
NEW YORK CITY
CLARA ADAMS carried this letter
on the Inaugural Trans-Atlantic
Passenger Flight aboard the DIXIE
Clipper - the first leg of her
globe girdling air trip.
Ticket
No.1.
PORTUGAL
ORREIO
AEREO 2$50
COLDOG
00021-0
VIA AIR MAIL
* *
*
CORREO AEREO
*
*
Frence Lampit
VION
5364 sydenhan
Phila., Pa
U SA

Captain R. 0. D. Lullevan
Duque Clipper, Pt Washington
R.S.
VIA
VIA AIR MAIL
* *
*
CORREO AEREO
*
*
PARAVION
2000.05 8.1270.22

PAAO
PAN AMERICAN AIRWAYS,
INC.
GENERAL OFFICES - CHRYSLER BUILDING - NEW
YORK CITY
Clara Adams is thinking of you while
soaring over land and sea on her world flight.
The Inaugural Passenger Flight across
the Atlantic in the Pan American Clipper "Dixie"
was a wonderful start.
If all goes well, I should be back in
New York between July 14th and 20th.
Sincerely,
Clara Adams
AIR 22
MAIL

PAAC
PAN AMERICAN AIRWAYS, INC.
GENERAL OFFICES - CHRYSLER BUILDING - NEW YORK CITY
Clara Adams is thinking of you while
soaring over land and sea on her world flight.
The Inaugural Passenger Flight across
the Atlantic in the Pan American Clipper "Dixie"
was a wonderful start.
If all goes well, I should be back in
New York between July 14th and 20th.
Sincerely,
Clara Adams
MAIL
properties.sfomuseum:creditline: Gift of the Pan Am Association
properties.sfomuseum:description: Airmail flight cover, carried by Clara Adams on the first around-the-world (circumglobal) passenger flight on the Pan American Airways “Dixie Clipper”; typed certificate in upper left corner indicating letter was carried on the transatlantic leg of the trip; signed by Clara Adams and W.J. Eck with note “Ticket No. 1”; postmarked June 30, 1939 in Lisbon with three Portuguese stamps; written on reverse in pencil "Captain R.O.D. Sullivan, Dixie Clipper, Pt Washington”; no backstamp.a. Envelopeb & c. Insert; two identical typed unsigned letters from Clara Adams on Pan American Airways letterhead, New York City, "Clara Adams is thinking of you while soaring over land and sea on her world flight. The Inaugural Passenger Flight across the Atlantic in the Pan American Clipper "Dixie" was a wonderful start. If all goes well, I should be back in New York between July 14 and 20th."
properties.wof:name: airmail flight cover: Pan American Airways, Boeing 314 “Dixie Clipper”, Clara Adams
